title: Drawing, ""Dixie"", 1861
medium: Brush and gray and brown wash, graphite on cream-colored paper
markings: Stamped in black ink, at lower right corner:  Cooper Union Museum for the Decorative Arts; Lugt 457d.
inscribed: Inscribed in brown ink, at top: "DIXIE; at end of barrel: Contraband; and at top left: An easy still; and in graphite, over women in background: Far trees.
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Vertical view of the interior of a shed with an African American male sitting on a barrel with a view through a window of what appear to be women carrying heavy loads.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ""Dixie"", 1861.
1861. Brush and gray and brown wash, graphite on cream-colored paper. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-120.
